data.title: Outstanding flavor
data.text: Loved the restaurant. We both enjoyed the evening special 1 fish, 1 with beef. The Brussel Sprouts appetizer was fantastic.

data.title: Healthy options
data.text: Great food. Not your run-of-the-mill, humdrum fare. The special was sole atop of roasted brussel sprouts, sweet potatoes and broccoli on a bed of cauliflower puree. It was excellent! They also offer an amazing burger and fries. Great friendly staff and fast service! If I return to bend I will return there!

data.title: Superb!
data.text: This was our last meal while in Bend, and dang it they really showed up strong. The layout is like a diner but the finishes give it an intimate bar feel. A bag of popcorn and your choice of water (tap, bottled, or sparkling) to start. They had a Monday special that was a draft beer or wine (I went with a local mild IPA), steak, fries, and salad for $14. What a deal. The maple brined pork chop was perfectly cooked and the daily fish and fresh veggies were stellar. Everything is attractively plated and gives you a more formal experience. We had happy tummies and spirits that we stayed for a liquid dessert - the Cardamom Buttered Rum and Salted Caramel Apple Pie. Both were balanced on bite and sweetness. We had picked Drake on a whim but it was fate to have such a perfect meal before saying bye to Bend.

data.title: Late lunch
data.text: Wes topped in for a lunch lunch after a day of driving. I am so happy we did.. the food was great. I had the steak frites... so good! Service was friendly.

data.title: Average food, very loud atmosphere
data.text: The wife and I ate here for dinner on Saturday October 22, 2016 before a show at the Tower. I had the "Bendie Burger" while the wife had the fried chicken, and while there was nothing wrong with anything, for the price they charged, there was nothing great about anything either. They started you out with a paper baggie of burned looking popcorn? What's up with that? My burger looked and tasted like it came from the Bend Burger Co. next door (they make very good burgers mind you) just more expensive. The fries were so salty they started to burn my mouth so I couldn't finish them. The wife's fried chicken was over-cooked and very dry. The best part of her meal was the pickled cranberries and the escarole salad. Add to this the place was just plain loud. Holding a normal restaurant conversation across the table was out of the question. How did this place get to be the #10 restaurant on the list? Again, nothing was bad but for the prices they charge we were expecting a little more "greatness". If you want free popcorn go to your local hardware store...if you want a good burger and fries go next door to the Bend Burger Co. and pay less and if you want some good fried chicken try the Thriftway in Terrebonne. We won't be back.

data.title: Like an oasis in the desert
data.text: The 6 of us were driving all day from Pocatello (visiting Yellowstone) on the way to Crator Lake. Spent a night in John Days (clean Best Western there) - terrible food in the whole town -  then we came upon Bend, Oregon. I never heard of it (I am ashamed to say since  I am American), and my East European friends barely knew where Oregon was. Bend was like a jewel in a desert.  We stopped at this lovely, authentic town and were recommended to go eat at the Drake restaurant. It was packed but the waiter/manager? put together 3 little tables outside to create a table for us. From then on it was nothing but great. Wine, food, service. In fact, one of my European friends ordered salmon and asked the waitress if it was fresh or frozen? She gave him the "Do bears sh... in the woods" look and said:"Of course, sir, you're in Oregon". To sum it up: great restaurant, I recommend it.

data.title: Bummer but I'll get over it
data.text: The signboard out front listed Butternut Squash soup but they had already sold out by the time I got in for lunch. I had the Fish and Chips and they were good, nothing to write home to mom about but good. I'll give DRAKE another try another day.

data.title: Fresh food and delicious cocktails!
data.text: A friend recommended my husband and I go to Drake for dinner and be sure to order a Bohemian cocktail.  They have a great variety of cocktails, but since the Bohemian is made with gin -- and we are gin drinkers -- we each ordered one.  They are unique and delicious and chilled just right!  The dinner menu is wonderful.  A good variety of dishes so there is something for everyone.  I ordered the cheeseburger and it was seriously one of the best burgers I've ever eaten!  My husband ordered Portobello mushroom fries served on beer cheese and he loved them.  It was quite a large order too!  He also ordered mac n cheese which he thought was incredibly good.  The portions are large and we were not able to eat all of our meals.  Sadly, we also were too full for dessert!  I will eat here again anytime I am in Bend.

data.title: Par excellanze
data.text: Exceeded expectations with super friendly and very  well managed classic corner more than a bistro restaurant. The crab cakes were superb as well as the chicken breast and of course delicious mac and cheese in a skillet. Truly a must go to when enjoying yourself in downtown  Bend.

data.title: Food good - portions small
data.text:
Had a great dinner at Drake, but pretty disappointed in the portion.  My wife and son both had burgers and they were nice and very good.  I had the shrimp and grits.  I frequently travel to the south and love shrimp and grits.  This was good, but not quite like i'm used to eating them in the south.  Portion was very small.  Some friends that we were with had various other items that seemed to have average size portions, so maybe it was just the shrimp and grits that isn't too big?  Worth a shot, but with all of the other places to eat in Bend, I'll probably choose another location next time.

It is small and pretty darn noisy, so not a good place for a business meeting, but appropriate for dinner with family and/or friends.

data.title: Fine food, attentive service, warm atmosphere
data.text: Certainly one of the best restaurants in Bend. Warm comfortable atmosphere. Strong service and fine food. A good mix of seafoods and meats are on offer. All are prepared with care and tasty. The bartender, a showman himself, is a talented agile member of the team, mixing an imaginative drink selection.

data.title: Pleasant outdoor ambience with excellent food
data.text: My wife and I enjoyed a delicious meal here. We were joined by 3 friends. The outdoor table was perfect for a relaxed meal of delicious food. Several people enjoyed the Shrimp & Grits and I loved the brazed pork shank. My wife had the Kale salad with shrimp and really liked it. Great service, nice atmosphere and wonderful food.

data.title: A new Bend eatery
data.text: I haven't been to Bend in awhile, and it has a bunch of new restaurants, including DRAKE.  We didn't have a reservation, but got a table outside, and enjoyed a delicious dinner while people walking by admired our fare.  Everything was unique and comforting to a couple of weary travelers.  Recommend!

data.title: Comfort Food Extraordinaire
data.text: This a a fabulous restaurant for awesome comfort food.  All of our meals here have been just great and the service is extremely professional.  Owner Ted stops by our table to talk and check on our satisfaction and is genuinely interested in our comments.  A full bar and excellent wine list makes meal time a treasure.

data.title: So Good that we just keep coming back again and again
data.text: Went for lunch at Drake - very busy but service was fantastic and the food was oh so good.  Started with a baked Brie served with blackberry and jalapeno jam with sparrow bread - WOW!  I had the beet salad which was terrific and my wife had the corn soup and grilled cheese sandwich.  Love this place so we keep coming back.

data.title: Holy Awesome!
data.text: We stopped for lunch before heading home from our weekend in Bend. The service was great, the popcorn is fantastic. I had the mahi mahi tacos and was very happy. My husband had the soft shell crab blt. He loved it! We will make this a tradition when we visit Bend.

data.title: Good, sometimes really good.
data.text: We have eaten here several times since they opened a few years ago.  The food is always good, but I have a hard time being thrilled.  It's usually very crowded, and it seems to have a "frantic" air about the restaurant. There is a guy that often/always? greets people.  He seems to be a GM or owner, but not sure. I think he may be the source of the frantic ambience--he's not very warm, even when seating or bringing food/silverware, etc.  Anyway, the menu has some really nice items.  Good drinks.  Lots of people seem to like it. Service is usually good.

data.title: Outstandin service
data.text: Our waitress was wonderful.  She had a great sense of humor and she knew the menu perfectly.  She could and did recommend excellent choices.  My wife and I split a kale salad and lambchops.  They were to die for.  So far this has been the best dining experience we have enjoyed in the area and that is saying a lot due to the wonderful array of restaurants in the area.  The only negative is it is a bit noisy.

data.title: Don't miss the shakes!
data.text: It's worth dropping into Drake just to get a caramel or chocolate shake. Beyond that the food and drinks were fine as was the service. Drake is not a great place to eat if you are trying to have a conversation unless you sit at one of the tables outside. It can get very loud when its busy. Drake puts a twist of one sort or another on most dishes. The night we ate here we had the fried chicken, pork chop, and a cheeseburger. Everyone thought their dish was fine, but not the best ever or anything that would encourage them to come back and order the same dish again. So, as the score reflects Drake is very good, but not really great.

data.title: A superb restaurant - best in Bend!
data.text:
What a place!
Delicious lunch in a great atmosphere with terrific service!
We sat at the counter and watched the chefs at work ... very organised, very smooth flow, very impressive and very clean!
Excellent soup and salads ... and french fries too ... sorry we did not have room for dessert ... next time!
